required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Safety and Effectiveness of the Technols 217z Zyoptix System for Hyperopia

brief_summary.textblock: A study to demonstrate the safety and effectiveness of wavefront laser refractive surgery treatments for hyperopia and astigmatism.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Eyes With Uncorrected Visual Acuity (UCVA) of 20/40 or Better at 12 Months and 24 Months
Percentage of Eyes With a Postoperative Subjective Manifest Refraction Spherical Equivalent (MRSE) Within ± 1.00 Diopter (D) and ± 0.50 D of Emmetropia.
primary_outcome.description: Manifest refractions (eyeglass prescriptions) have three components: sphere, cylinder, and axis. Sphere and cylinder are both expressed in diopters, which is a continuous measure of the focusing power needed to make the image sharp on the retina. Manifest refraction spherical equivalent (MRSE) is equal to sphere + ½ x cylinder. It is expressed in diopters (D).

primary_outcome.measure: The Percentage of Eyes With a Postoperative Subjective Manifest Refraction Spherical Equivalent (MRSE) Within ± 1.00 Diopter (D) and ± 0.50 D of Emmetropia
primary_outcome.description: Manifest refractions (eyeglass prescriptions) have three components: sphere, cylinder, and axis. Sphere and cylinder are both expressed in diopters, which is a continuous measure of the focusing power needed to make the image sharp on the retina. Manifest refraction spherical equivalent (MRSE) is equal to sphere + ½ x cylinder. It is expressed in diopters (D).

primary_outcome.measure: Refractive Stability - Categorical Change Between Month 1 and Month 3
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of eyes with a change of ≤ 1.00 Diopter in manifest refraction spherical equivalent (MRSE) between postoperative refractions, performed at 1 months and 3 months after surgery. Manifest refractions (eyeglass prescriptions) have three components: sphere, cylinder, and axis. Sphere and cylinder are both expressed in diopters, which is a continuous measure of the focusing power needed to make the image sharp on the retina. Manifest refraction spherical equivalent (MRSE) is equal to sphere + ½ x cylinder. It is expressed in diopters (D).

primary_outcome.measure: Refractive Stability - Mean Change Between Month 1 and Month 3
primary_outcome.description: Mean change in manifest refraction spherical equivalent (MRSE) between postoperative refractions, performed at 1 months and 3 months after surgery. Manifest refractions (eyeglass prescriptions) have three components: sphere, cylinder, and axis. Sphere and cylinder are both expressed in diopters, which is a continuous measure of the focusing power needed to make the image sharp on the retina. Manifest refraction spherical equivalent (MRSE) is equal to sphere + ½ x cylinder. It is expressed in diopters (D).
Percentage of eyes which had >2.00 Diopter of induced refractive cylinder for those eyes treated for spherical hyperopia only.

secondary_outcome.measure: Loss of Best Spectacle-corrected Visual Acuity (BSCVA)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of eyes with loss of best spectacle corrected visual acuity (BSCVA) of >2 lines. Mean change in best-corrected high contrast distance visual acuity. Corrected means spectacle corrected. Visual acuity (VA) was reported as letters read correctly, and the letters read were converted to logarithm of the minimum angle of resolution (logMAR) acuity. The participant read rows of letters on a standard LogMAR chart until the participant misses 3 letters on a row with 5 letters. The total number of correct letters were recorded. A decrease in the number of correct letters indicates a decrease in visual acuity. Acuity was averaged across visits.

arm_group.description: Bausch & Lomb Technolas 217z Zyoptix System with Treatment Planner Customized Treatment Calculation Software.

intervention.description: Technolas 217z Zyoptix System with Treatment Planner Customized Treatment Calculation Software for the wavefront-guided LASIK treatment of hyperopia and hyperoptic astigmatism.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Hyperopia with or without astigmatism.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindications to LASIK.

group.description: Bausch & Lomb Technolas 217z Zyoptix System with Treatment Planner Customized Treatment Calculation Software. Technolas 217z Zyoptix Laser: Technolas 217z Zyoptix System with Treatment Planner Customized Treatment Calculation Software for the wavefront-guided LASIK treatment of hyperopia and hyperoptic astigmatism.

outcome.title: Percentage of Eyes With Uncorrected Visual Acuity (UCVA) of 20/40 or Better at 12 Months and 24 Months
outcome.population: The number of eyes available for uncorrected visual acuity assessment at 12 months and 24 months were included in the analysis.

outcome.description: Manifest refractions (eyeglass prescriptions) have three components: sphere, cylinder, and axis. Sphere and cylinder are both expressed in diopters, which is a continuous measure of the focusing power needed to make the image sharp on the retina. Manifest refraction spherical equivalent (MRSE) is equal to sphere + ½ x cylinder. It is expressed in diopters (D).
outcome.population: The number of eyes available for manifest refraction spherical equivalent assessment at 12 months were included in the analysis.

measure.title: The Percentage of Eyes With a Postoperative Subjective Manifest Refraction Spherical Equivalent (MRSE) Within ± 1.00 Diopter (D) and ± 0.50 D of Emmetropia
measure.description: Manifest refractions (eyeglass prescriptions) have three components: sphere, cylinder, and axis. Sphere and cylinder are both expressed in diopters, which is a continuous measure of the focusing power needed to make the image sharp on the retina. Manifest refraction spherical equivalent (MRSE) is equal to sphere + ½ x cylinder. It is expressed in diopters (D).

outcome.title: Refractive Stability - Categorical Change Between Month 1 and Month 3
outcome.description: Percentage of eyes with a change of ≤ 1.00 Diopter in manifest refraction spherical equivalent (MRSE) between postoperative refractions, performed at 1 months and 3 months after surgery. Manifest refractions (eyeglass prescriptions) have three components: sphere, cylinder, and axis. Sphere and cylinder are both expressed in diopters, which is a continuous measure of the focusing power needed to make the image sharp on the retina. Manifest refraction spherical equivalent (MRSE) is equal to sphere + ½ x cylinder. It is expressed in diopters (D).
outcome.population: There were 139 eyes with manifest refraction spherical equivalent assessments at both Month 1 and Month 3 for this outcome assessment.

outcome.title: Induced Astigmatism
outcome.description: Percentage of eyes which had >2.00 Diopter of induced refractive cylinder for those eyes treated for spherical hyperopia only.
outcome.population: There were 32 sphere eyes assessed for this outcome measure.

measure.title: Induced Astigmatism
measure.description: Percentage of eyes which had >2.00 Diopter of induced refractive cylinder for those eyes treated for spherical hyperopia only.
measure.population: There were 32 sphere eyes assessed for this outcome measure.

outcome.title: Loss of Best Spectacle-corrected Visual Acuity (BSCVA)
outcome.description: Percentage of eyes with loss of best spectacle corrected visual acuity (BSCVA) of >2 lines. Mean change in best-corrected high contrast distance visual acuity. Corrected means spectacle corrected. Visual acuity (VA) was reported as letters read correctly, and the letters read were converted to logarithm of the minimum angle of resolution (logMAR) acuity. The participant read rows of letters on a standard LogMAR chart until the participant misses 3 letters on a row with 5 letters. The total number of correct letters were recorded. A decrease in the number of correct letters indicates a decrease in visual acuity. Acuity was averaged across visits.
outcome.population: The number of eyes available for uncorrected visual acuity assessment at 12 months and 24 months were included in the analysis.

measure.title: Loss of Best Spectacle-corrected Visual Acuity (BSCVA)
measure.description: Percentage of eyes with loss of best spectacle corrected visual acuity (BSCVA) of >2 lines. Mean change in best-corrected high contrast distance visual acuity. Corrected means spectacle corrected. Visual acuity (VA) was reported as letters read correctly, and the letters read were converted to logarithm of the minimum angle of resolution (logMAR) acuity. The participant read rows of letters on a standard LogMAR chart until the participant misses 3 letters on a row with 5 letters. The total number of correct letters were recorded. A decrease in the number of correct letters indicates a decrease in visual acuity. Acuity was averaged across visits.
measure.population: The number of eyes available for uncorrected visual acuity assessment at 12 months and 24 months were included in the analysis.

reported_events.desc: Adverse events (AEs) were assessed throughout the study. AEs were not coded (therefore, there is no source vocabulary).

group.title: Technolas 217z Zyoptix System
group.description: Bausch & Lomb Technolas 217z Zyoptix System with Treatment Planner Customized Treatment Calculation Software. certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
